target.name: use-maven
target.fail: You must use maven to run the demos. Run 'mvn install' for further help.

target.name: usage
target.echo: To run an example:
1) In a separate console window,start either a standalone JBoss AS instance or a JBoss AS domain
2) Run mvn package -Dexample=<example.name> where "exammple.name is the name of the example
Valid example names to run against a standalone JBoss AS instance are
ejb3 - deploys simple EJB3 examples and invokes on the beans
sar - deploys mbeans packaged in a sar
managedbean - deploys a managed bean
serviceloader - deploys a serviceloader style service
messaging - deploys HornetQ native sender and receiver
jaxrs - deploys a jax-rs war
jms - deploys HornetQ JMS sender and receiver
jms.client - Uses HornetQ JMS API from the client
rar - deploys a resource adapter
ds - deploys a test bean for data sources
war - deploys a simple servlet and connects to it
ws - deploys a simple JAXWS POJO endpoint and invokes it
wsejb - deploys a simple JAXWS EJB3 endpoint and invokes it
ear - deploys an ear
jpa - deploys simple JPA example
client.messaging - creates a HornetQ core queue using the management API
client.jms - creates a JMS queue using the management API
web.connector - creates and removes a jboss web connector
Valid example names to run against a JBoss AS domain are
domain.configs - reads the domain config and any available host controller configs
domain.ds - deploys deploys a test bean for data sources
domain.interactive - interactive client that allows user to perform various management operations
domain.messaging - deploys HornetQ native sender and receiver
domain.rar - deploys deploys a resource adapter
domain.servers - shows domain, host controller and server configs, starts/stops servers

target.name: run
target.echo: -Dexample=${example} was passed in. Running org.jboss.as.demos.${example}.runner.ExampleRunner
